clump:
树木的丛，簇，束； 人的 群，组； 草的堆； 毛发的缕 
a small group of things or people very close together, especially trees or plants; a bunch of 
something such as grass or hair

沉重的脚步声 
the sound made by somebody putting their feet down very heavily
torture:
折磨，拷问 
to cause (someone) to experience severe physical pain especially as a form of punishment 
or to force that person to do or say something 
51
foul:
体育运动中对对手犯规 
(in sport) to do something to another player that is against the rules of the game

棒球击球出界 
(in baseball) to hit the ball outside the playing area

通常用废物弄脏，污染 
to make something dirty, usually with waste material

肮脏恶臭的；难闻的 
dirty and smelling bad
illustrious:
杰出的，光辉灿烂的 
admired and respected very much because a lot was achieved
preach:
布道 
to make a speech about religion in a church or other public place; to deliver a sermon

宣扬 
to write or speak about (something) in an approving way; to say that (something) is good 
or necessary
jostle:
推挤 
to push against (someone) while moving forward in a crowd of people

激烈竞争 
to struggle or compete forcefully for
impending:
即将发生的 
happening or likely to happen soon
subside:
减弱，减轻 
to become less strong or intense

下降，坐下 
to move down to a lower level
manifest:
明显的 
able to be seen; clearly shown or visible

证明，表明 
to show (something) clearly
egalitarian:
平等主义的 
aiming for equal wealth, status, etc., for all people
spawn: 产卵 to produce or lay eggs in water — used of animals such as fish or frogs

造成 
to cause (something) to develop or begin; to produce or create (something)
disperse:
分散 
to go or move in different directions; to spread apart 
52
deride:
嘲笑 
to talk or write about (someone or something) in a very critical or insulting way
lateral:
侧面的 
toward, on, or coming from the side
ferocious:
凶猛的，残暴的 
frightening and violent
interval:
间隔的时间或空间 
with an amount of time/space in between
outlaw:
罪犯，不法之徒 
a person who has broken the law and who is hiding or running away to avoid punishment

宣布 不合法 
to make (something) illegal
mutant:
突变体 
a plant or animal that is different from other plants or animals of the same kind because of 
a change in the structure of its genes

突变的 
of, relating to, or produced by mutation
trenchant:
简明的，有力的，犀利的，尖锐的 
very strong, clear, and effective

锐利的，锋利的 
(of a weapon or tool) having a sharp edge
prolific:
多产的 
producing a large amount of something
enact:
扮演 
to perform (something, such as a scene in a play)

颁布；制定法律 
to make (a bill or other legislation) officially become part of the law
loophole:
漏洞 
an error in the way a law, rule, or contract is written that makes it possible for some people 
to legally avoid obeying it
congestion:
堵塞，拥堵；淤血 
overcrowding; abnormal accumulation (of blood, fluid, etc.)
split:
使分离 
to break apart or into pieces especially along a straight line
ascribe:
把 归因于；认为 是由于 
to consider that something is caused by a particular thing or person

认为是 的特点；认为 具有 
to consider that somebody or something has or should have a particular quality
majesty:
壮观，庄严，雄伟 
the quality of being beautiful, dignified, and impressive
inscrutable:
难以理解的 
difficult to understand; causing people to feel curious or confused
resentful:
怨恨的 
having or showing a feeling of anger or displeasure about someone or something unfair
prune:
修剪 
to cut off some of the branches of (a tree or bush) so that it will grow better or look better
bigot:
抱偏见的人；执拗的人 
a person who is obstinately or intolerantly devoted to his or her own opinions and prejudices 
54
factious:
源于派别的，好搞宗派活动的 
relating or inclined to a state of faction
curator:
馆长；监护人 
a person who is in charge of the things in a museum, zoo, etc.
nourish:
提供营养，滋养 
to provide (someone or something) with food and other things that are needed to live, be 
healthy, etc.
reprieve:
撤销 的死刑；缓期执行 的死刑 
to officially cancel or delay a punishment for a prisoner who is condemned to death

暂缓，延缓 
a delay before something bad happens
undo:
撤销；抵消；消除 
to change or stop the effect of (something); reverse

解开；松开；打开 
to open or release (something); to unfasten or loosen (something)
augment:
增大 
to increase the size or amount of (something)
spurn:
拒绝 
to refuse to accept (someone or something that you do not think deserves your respect, 
attention, affection, etc.)
ambivalent:
矛盾情绪的 
having or showing very different feelings (such as love and hate) about someone or 
something at the same time
consolation:
使感到安慰的人或事；安慰；慰藉 
a person or thing providing comfort to a person who has suffered; the comfort received by 
a person after a loss or disappointment
obdurate:
执拗的；顽固不化的 
refusing to do what other people want; not willing to change your opinion or the way you 
do something
withdrawn:
内向的，孤僻的 
very quiet and usually shy; not talking much to other people
conjecture:
推测 
an opinion or idea formed without proof or sufficient evidence 
55
judicious:
明智的 
having or showing good judgment; wise
magnitude:
星等；震级； 爆炸的强度 
a number that shows the power of an earthquake, the brightness of a star, etc.

巨大，庞大，重要 性 
the size, extent, or importance of something
negligent:
疏忽的 
failing to take proper or normal care of something or someone
dismissive:
轻蔑的 
showing that you do not think something or someone is worth thinking about or considering
conspicuous:
显眼的 
very easy to see or notice
vanquish:
征服 
to defeat (someone) completely in a war, battle, etc.
avenge:
报仇 
to harm or punish someone who has harmed you or someone or something that you care about
empirical:
经验主义的 
based on testing or experience
swallow:
吞咽 
to take (something) into your stomach through your mouth and throat

忍受 
to not allow yourself to show or be affected by (an emotion)
affinity:
密切关系 
a feeling of closeness and understanding that someone has for another person because of 
their similar qualities, ideas, or interests 
56
scorn:
轻蔑；鄙视 
a strong feeling that somebody/something is stupid or not good enough, usually shown by 
the way you speak

轻蔑；鄙视 
to feel or show that you think somebody/something is stupid and you do not respect them 
or it

不屑于接受或做；轻蔑地拒绝 
to refuse to have or do something because you are too proud
whimsy:
怪念头；古怪可笑的举动；奇思异想 
a way of thinking or behaving, or a style of doing something that is unusual and not 
serious, in a way that is either amusing or annoying
famine:
饥荒 
a situation in which many people do not have enough food to eat
allegiance:
忠诚 
loyalty to a person, country, group, etc.
surveillance:
监视 
the act of carefully watching someone or something especially in order to prevent or detect 
a crime
partition:
隔断；隔扇；隔板墙 
a wall or screen that separates one part of a room from another

分割；分治；瓜分 
the division of one country into two or more countries

分割；分裂；分开 
to divide something into two parts
sway:
影响 
a controlling force or influence

摇摆 
to move slowly back and forth
unseemly:
不适宜的；不得体的 
not proper or appropriate for the situation; not seemly
spatial:
空间的 
of or relating to space and the relationship of objects within it
ordeal:
煎熬，磨难，折磨 
an experience that is very unpleasant or difficult 
57
dismay:
沮丧，灰心 
a strong feeling of being worried, disappointed, or upset

使沮丧 
to cause (someone) to feel very worried, disappointed, or upset
aerobic:
有氧的 
living, active, or occurring only in the presence of oxygen
incur:
招致 
to cause yourself to have or experience (something unpleasant or unwanted)
mainstay:
中流砥柱，支柱，中坚 
a very important part of something
artful:
狡猾的 
good at getting or achieving things in ways that are clever and not noticeable
malfunction:
故障 
a failure to operate or function in the normal or correct manner

出故障 
to fail to function or work properly
impersonate:
模仿，假冒 
to pretend to be (another person) 
partake in 参与 
participate in
drab:
无聊的 
not bright or colorful; too plain or dull to be interesting
apex:
巅峰 
the top or highest point of something
bane: 祸根，烦恼之源 a cause of trouble, annoyance, or unhappiness — usually used in the phrase the bane of
revise:
修正 
to look at or consider again an idea, piece of writing, etc. in order to correct or improve it

对历史事件持修正主义论的 
promoting a revised attitude to a previously accepted situation or point of view
provenance:
发源地；起源；出处 
the place that something originally came from
indignation:
愤慨；愤怒；义愤 
anger or annoyance provoked by what is perceived as unfair treatment 
58
wobble:
摆动 
to (cause something to) shake or move from side to side in a way that shows 
poor balance
concur:
同意 
to agree with someone or something
vibrant:
精力充沛的 
having or showing great life, activity, and energy
drown:
溺死 
to die by being underwater too long and unable to breathe

淹没 
to cover (something) completely with a liquid
distort:
使变形；扭曲；使失真 
to change the shape, appearance or sound of something so that it is strange or not clear

歪曲；曲解 
to twist or change facts, ideas, etc. so that they are no longer correct or true
